revised_title: Caffeine's Effect on Inositol-Trisphosphate-Induced Calcium Oscillations
tldr: The author's study found that caffeine inhibits inositol-trisphosphate (InsP3)-induced membrane potential oscillations in Xenopus oocytes. Caffeine does not affect the initial spike but suppresses the subsequent oscillations. This discovery provides insights into the two-pool model for generating calcium oscillations and the role of caffeine in calcium signaling.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Cellular Biology and Physiology
